result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin C Radschlag was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Radschlag to serve six months in Jail, with Huber.  Mr. Radschlag is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Huber Release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 drug testing fee, plus $25 drug buy money, plus $33 in subpoena fees

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol unless allowed by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at work or educational programming as allowed by the Agent 
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; to occur at least once per month during the first year, and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision

Arresting Agency: JCSD


  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin C Radschlag

records.addlTxt:
case called at 10:45am. [MK]
Defendant Benjamin C Radschlag in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel. 
Statements are given by Mr. Radschlag's brother and mother. 
Mr. Radschlag makes a brief statement. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Radschlag to serve six months in Jail, with Huber.  Mr. Radschlag is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system;  non-compliance will result in loss of Huber Release privileges without further process.
Days credit for time already served:  0  days


The Court STAYS this sentence, and places Mr. Radschlag on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--no possession or consumption of alcohol unless allowed by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as allowed by the Agent, and except for incidental contact at work or educational programming as allowed by the Agent 
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing; to occur at least once per month during the first year, and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $25 drug testing fee, plus $25 drug buy money, plus $33 in subpoena fees

Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given 
recess 11:07am
Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

case called at 11:44am. [MK]
Defendant Benjamin C Radschlag in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On Motion of the State, the Court amends the charge to Class I felony Possession of THC 2nd or Subsequent Offense, contrary to Statute 961.41(3g)(e). 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Radschlag guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On request of the Defense, the Court will schedule the sentencing hearing on a later date.
Mr. Radschlag verifies that the Charles Street, Watertown address is current. 
recess 11:55am. 

NEXT: schedule Sentencing Hearing in early December, please avoid scheduling on a Wednesday or Thursday

case called at 1:17  pm. 
Defendant Benjamin C Radschlag in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,500  Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescription medications as prescribed
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess 1:20pm.
